intro: Licania paraensis, commonly known as the Paraense Licania, is a species of flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Licania paraensis plays a role in the ecological dynamics of its habitat, providing food and shelter for various wildlife species.
